message.content:
cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.CV 

The paper proposes a new algorithm for training neural networks, which falls under the category of machine learning. The algorithm is based on stochastic local search with binary representation, which is a common technique used in optimization problems. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). The paper also discusses the effects of different parameters on the performance of the algorithm, such as the number of bits per weight and the maximum weight range, which are related to machine learning theory and optimization. This suggests that cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions real-world applications, such as feedback control, which falls under the category of control systems, suggesting cs.SY (Systems and Control) as another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper validates the algorithm on image classification tasks, which is a common application of neural networks, suggesting cs.CV (Computer Vision) as a possible sub-category.
